trans-unit.source: The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListView"></xref> class specifies how to conduct a virtual list view search.
A virtual list view search enables users to view search results as address-book style virtual list views.
It is specifically designed for very large result sets.
Search data is retrieved in contiguous subsets of a sorted directory search.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListView"></xref> class.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListView"></xref> class with the after count set.
A <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> data type object that gets or sets a value to indicate the number of entries after the target entry that the client is requesting from the server.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListView"></xref> class with the before count, after count, and offset set.
A <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> data type objects that gets or sets a value to indicate the number of entries after the target entry that the client is requesting from the server.
A <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> data type object that gets or sets a value to indicate the number of entries after the target entry that the client is requesting from the server.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> data type that gets or sets a value to indicate the estimated target entry's requested offset within the list.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListView"></xref> class with the before count, after count, and target set.
A <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> data type objects that gets or sets a value to indicate the number of entries after the target entry that the client is requesting from the server.
A <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> data type object that gets or sets a value to indicate the number of entries after the target entry that the client is requesting from the server.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that gets or sets a value to indicate the desired target entry requested by the client.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListView"></xref> class with the before count, after count, offset and context set.
A <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> data type objects that gets or sets a value to indicate the number of entries after the target entry that the client is requesting from the server.
A <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> data type object that gets or sets a value to indicate the number of entries after the target entry that the client is requesting from the server.
An <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> data type that gets or sets a value to indicate the estimated target entry's requested offset within the list.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListViewContext"></xref> data type objects that gets or sets a value to indicate the virtual list view search response.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListView"></xref> class with the before count, after count, target and context set.
A <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> data type objects that gets or sets a value to indicate the number of entries after the target entry that the client is requesting from the server.
A <xref href="System.Int32"></xref> data type object that gets or sets a value to indicate the number of entries after the target entry that the client is requesting from the server.
A <xref href="System.String"></xref> that gets or sets a value to indicate the desired target entry requested by the client.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListViewContext"></xref> data type objects that gets or sets a value to indicate the virtual list view search response.
Gets or sets a value to indicate the number of entries after the target entry that the client is requesting from the server.
An integer value that represents the number of entries after the target entry that the client is requesting from the server.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListView.AfterCount"></xref> property is set to a value less than zero.
Gets or sets a value to indicate the estimated total count of items in the list.
An integer value that represents the estimated total count of items in the list.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListView.ApproximateTotal"></xref> property is set to a value less than zero.
Gets or sets a value to indicate the number of entries before the target entry that the client is requesting from the server.
An integer value that represents the number of entries before the target entry that the client is requesting from the server.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListView.BeforeCount"></xref> property is set to a value less than 0.
Gets or sets a value to indicate the virtual list view search response.
A <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListViewContext"></xref> that indicates the virtual list view search response.
Gets or sets a value to indicate the target entry's offset within the list.

When this property is set, a new value for the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListView.TargetPercentage%2A> property is computed by dividing the value of the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListView.Offset%2A> property by the value of the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListView.ApproximateTotal%2A> property, and multiplying the result by 100.
An integer value that represents the target entry's estimated offset within the list.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListView.Offset"></xref> property is set to a value less than 0.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListView.Target"></xref> property gets or sets a value to indicate the target entry that was requested by the client.
A string that contains the target entry that was requested by the client.

The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListView.TargetPercentage"></xref> property gets or sets a value to indicate the estimated target entry's requested offset within the list, as a percentage of the total number of items in the list.

When this property is set, a new value for the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListView.Offset%2A> property is computed by multiplying the value of the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListView.ApproximateTotal%2A> property by the value of the <xref:System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListView.TargetPercentage%2A> property, and dividing the result by 100.
An integer value that represents the estimated percentage offset within the list of the target entry.
The <xref href="System.DirectoryServices.DirectoryVirtualListView.TargetPercentage"></xref> property is set to a value greater than 100 or less than 0.
